a tiny lapse can lead to a huge mistake (idiom); a minor discrepancy leading to enormous losses

definition: the slightest difference leads to a huge error (idiom)/a miss is as good as a mile

definition: a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)

definition: failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
to lose Jingzhou due to carelessness (idiom)/to suffer a major setback due to negligence
having given away a bride, to lose one's army on top of it (idiom)/to suffer a double loss after trying to trick the enemy

consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
lit. a wise person reflecting a thousand times can still make a mistake (idiom); fig. nobody is infallible

definition: to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory

a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer/fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions/ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
pinyin: cheng2 men2 shi1 huo3 , yang1 ji2 chi2 yu2

definition: to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
an ant hole may cause the collapse of a great dike (idiom)/huge damage may result from a moment's negligence

definition: lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
